Article Title: Banking Complaints Spike: Private Banks Lead, Digital Issues Dominate
Article Text:
The data reveals a shifting landscape where private banks and digital channels draw the most customer ire, while territories like Chandigarh and Delhi report disproportionately high complaint loads per lakh accounts.

India‚Äôs banking system saw a surge in customer grievances in FY25, with private sector banks accounting for the highest share of complaints. Issues linked to loans, credit cards and mobile/e-banking continue to dominate, even as complaint intensity varies widely across states.
Article Summary: The data reveals a shifting landscape where private banks and digital channels draw the most customer ire. Chandigarh and delhi report disproportionately high complaint loads per lakh accounts. Issues linked to loans, credit cards and mobile/e-banking continue to dominate, even as complaint intensity varies widely across states.

Article Title: CAFE 3 showdown: Carmakers clash as Maruti‚ÄìToyota push for new 'mini-car' category for availing emissions leniency
Article Text: NEW DELHI: It‚Äôs a straight fight between the Japanese power duo of Maruti Suzuki-Toyota who are pitted against the might of the rest of the car industry over the soon-to-be-announced CAFE 3 emission norms.A large section of India‚Äôs car industry huddled in a meeting with Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday, sans Maruti, Toyota Kirloskar, and French Renault, as they ‚Äúcomplained‚Äù about the aggressive charge spearheaded by the Japanese companies to push for creation of an all-new mini car category that will have vehicles under the weight of 909 kgs.The hush-hush meeting with Gadkari, late on Monday evening, was attended by a bevy of Indian and multinational carmakers that included local heavyweights Tata Motors and Mahindra & Mahindra, apart from the Korean siblings Hyundai and Kia, as well as JSW MG Motor.Ahead of the announcement of a final regulation on the new CAFE3 emission norms that will lay the roadmap for industry emissions from April 2027, the companies are ‚Äúworried‚Äù that creation of a new light-weight mini segment ‚Äî where 95% of vehicles are from the Maruti stable ‚Äî will lead to having ‚Äúarchitecturally unsafe cars‚Äù on the Indian roads while also disrupting their investment and new products plans, sources in the know told TOI.‚ÄúThis will be an aberration and will lead to creation of a completely unsafe car category as none of the existing vehicles in this so-called light-weight category have received adequate safety ratings by global agencies. Also, what is the logic of giving an easier emission target to this special category which unfairly benefits only one particular company,‚Äù the company representatives said in the meeting with Gadkari.Questions sent to Maruti Suzuki did not elicit a response.The joint representation of the companies said that any change in India‚Äôs vehicle classification rules, especially based on weight, will only end up disturbing their product and investment plans. ‚ÄúOur investment plans will be disrupted if the govt creates a new mini category on the lines of weight of a vehicle against the currently well-defined vehicle class of small cars,‚Äù the companies told the Minister.Currently, the lowest rung in car classification is made of ‚Äúsmall cars‚Äù which are vehicles that are under 4 meters in length and have petrol engines below 1200cc and diesel under 1500cc. ‚ÄúThis is the classification which is also used for GST purposes, and we are building our investments and plans based on this. What is the need for creating an all-new ‚Äòrandom‚Äô light-weight category of 909 kgs and below which doesn‚Äôt exist anywhere else across the world. ‚ÄùThe Minister told the companies to submit a representation on the matter even as the players have approached other ministries, including the Ministry of Heavy Industries, as well as the Ministry of Power.
Article Summary: A large section of india‚Äôs car industry huddled in a meeting with road transport and highways minister nitin gadkari on monday. They ‚Äúcomplained‚Äù about the aggressive charge spearheaded by the japanese companies to push for creation of an all-new mini car category that will have vehicles under 909 kgs.

Article Title: QTCinderella promises major changes for 2026 Streamer Awards after backlash
Article Text:
Image Via Instagram

‚Äúvery hard pivot‚Äù

‚Äúa movie,‚Äù

QTCinderella commits to new direction for Streamer Awards after criticism





QTCinderella, the creator and host of the annual Streamer Awards, is already looking ahead to 2026, and she‚Äôs making it clear that the event will undergo a major transformation. Following a year filled with controversy, backlash, and intense internet debate surrounding the 2025 edition, QT has promised afor next year‚Äôs show. She acknowledged the valid criticisms, noting that while putting on the awards is a massive undertaking, she is more motivated than ever to deliver something that lives up to community expectations and celebrates creators the way they deserve.The 2025 Streamer Awards faced heavy scrutiny from viewers online, with complaints ranging from segment execution and humor to concerns over category fairness, especially surrounding VTuber results. India Love‚Äôs appearance also sparked heated debate, and beyond typical criticism, QT received personal harassment that left her emotional during post-event streams. Despite the rough reception, she says the experience has only pushed her to learn, adapt and rebuild. In her recent December 8 stream, she promised next year‚Äôs show will beaiming for a much more polished and universally enjoyable experience.QT hinted that one of the biggest changes will be shifting the tone and structure of the show. She acknowledged that certain jokes and inside references, like bits about bans and behind-the-scenes drama, didn‚Äôt translate well to the larger audience watching at home.The host suggested the program will find a better balance between live crowd energy and viewer engagement, ensuring segments feel meaningful and entertaining to everyone, not just industry insiders.She also wants to deliver stronger pacing, more rewarding category moments, and a format that avoids niche or confusing humor. The takeaway from fans was clear: they love the event, but they want the production value and tone to match its growing scale. QT says she‚Äôs heard those messages loud and clear.QTCinderella‚Äôs transparency and willingness to pivot could reshape the future of fan-voted award shows in the streaming world. With big promises comes big pressure, but she‚Äôs determined to impress those who were disappointed this year. And if all goes as planned, the 2026 Streamer Awards could be her biggest comeback yet.Also Read: Twitch Streamer Tekashi 6ix9ine hit with strict supervised release after prison sentence
Article Summary: Qtcinderella, the creator and host of the annual streamer awards, is already looking ahead to 2026. Following a year filled with controversy, backlash, and intense internet debate surrounding the 2025 edition, qt has promised afor next year‚Äôs show.

Article Title: Chrisean Rock sparks huge outrage for calling QTCinderella‚Äôs Streamer Awards 2025 ‚ÄúRacist‚Äù after RaKai‚Äôs snub
Article Text:
Chrisean Rock (via Getty Images)

Chrisean Rock slams FaZe Adapt and The Streamer Awards 2025







A video of American rapper Chrisean Rock is going viral on social media. In the clip, she accused The Streamer Awards of being ‚Äúracist.‚Äù She claimed the show failed to honor RaKai and Darryl Dwayne Granberry Jr. , better known as DDG. The strong statement quickly spread across platforms and sparked intense debate. Many users reacted to her comments within hours of the video being shared.In the 26-second video, the 25-year-old shared her views on the 2025 edition of The Streamer Awards. She questioned the credibility of the awards and openly criticized the win of Alexander ‚ÄúFaZe Adapt‚Äù in the Best Breakout Streamer category. Her remarks have now triggered a wave of mixed reactions online.In the viral video, Chrisean Rock alleged that the event favored certain creators. She claimed the show only invited some people to promote others. She also directly questioned the win of FaZe Adapt. While speaking, she made several controversial remarks.‚ÄúNow, who the fk is Adapt? We know who RaKai and DDG is. But who is Adapt? The awards was racist. They racist as hell! Y‚Äôall only invited the n***** to promote the White people that we do not give a fk about.We don‚Äôt even know. You did not earn that st. That‚Äôs fked up‚Äù, Rock said.Soon after the video went viral, thousands of users reacted on X. Many criticized Rock for her language and claims. Others tried to defend the award results. One user wrote, ‚Äú‚ÄòThe awards were racist‚Äô is that why one black guy won like 5 awards?‚Äù. Another user commented, ‚ÄúAre yall dumb? Adapt been streaming before the black community knew about streaming . Thats one thing I hate about my people, some things are racist indeed but this is not . Kai , speed , etc they are like single years old . Faze, optic , gaming streamers been here since kids bro‚Äù.One user commented, ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs brain-dead. Kai and Speed won the most awards. Just because your For You page didn‚Äôt win anything doesn‚Äôt mean you get to use racism to justify their loss.‚ÄùThe controversy also reached popular streamers. Twitch streamer and FaZe Clan member Jason ‚ÄúJasontheween‚Äù also reacted to Rock‚Äôs comments. He posted a short response that read, ‚ÄúWrap this s**t up‚Äù.As the debate continues across social media, the host of The Streamer Awards has not yet addressed the situation. Blaire ‚ÄúQTCinderella,‚Äù who hosted the event, has also remained silent on the matter.Also Read: Plaqueboymax defends Kai Cenat‚Äôs pal Tylil James after heated reaction to Fanfan‚Äôs joke at Streamer Awards 2025
Article Summary: American rapper chrisean rock accused the streamer awards of being ‚Äúracist‚Äù she claimed the show failed to honor rakai and darryl dwayne granberry jr. better known as ddg. The strong statement quickly spread across platforms and sparked intense debate.

Article Title: Shohei Ohtani vs Juan Soto: Who really has the highest net worth in 2025?
Article Text:
Shohei Ohtani and Juan Soto (Image via: IG/X)

Shohei Ohtani is currently richer because of his growing net worth and massive endorsement income



Juan Soto becomes the highest yearly earner because he bet on himself and won the biggest contract

Shohei Ohtani and Juan Soto now headline baseball‚Äôs richest rivalry as their careers reshape how modern athletes earn and protect wealth. Ohtani is a Japanese megastar with an estimated net worth of 150 million dollars while Soto is a Dominican standout worth about 100 million dollars. Their new contracts changed the market yet their money flows differently which makes their comparison fascinating. One earns later through planning and global deals while the other takes home record money today.Ohtani rose in Japan as a two way star before joining MLB while Soto became a World Series hero at a young age. Both became must watch players but their financial paths were shaped by different choices. Ohtani signed a 10 year 700 million dollar deal with the Dodgers but gets only 2 million dollars over that span before the real money arrives from 2034. Soto signed a 15 year 765 million dollar deal with the Mets that pays him 51 million dollars yearly with no delays.Ohtani reached MLB with star status already built which helped him earn brands fast even when his salary was low. Between 2018 and 2022 he earned under 10 million dollars from baseball which is small compared to his value. His one year 30 million dollar deal in 2023 pushed him toward free agency and his record Dodgers deal followed soon after.His deferred plan gives security for later years while endorsements between 40 and 50 million dollars yearly build his wealth now.Ohtani is rare because he makes more away from baseball than on the field due to his worldwide following. His success in Japan and America made him a marketing face that few athletes ever reach. That combination lets him collect steady money today and huge checks in the future. His journey shows how fame plus patience can deliver long term financial power.Soto built his profile with confidence and production which earned the nickname ‚ÄúChildish Bambino‚Äù. He rejected a 13 year 350 million dollar offer and later turned down a 15 year 440 million dollar extension which shocked many. Those decisions led him to the largest baseball deal ever at 765 million dollars. From 2015 to 2024 he already earned 82 million dollars which added to his foundation.His contract with the Mets pays him now instead of later which makes him the richest player yearly in baseball today. His rise shows how the right gamble at the right time can change a career path. Soto proved that young stars can shape their own value instead of accepting early deals. His path gives the next generation a guide on how to chase true market worth.Ohtani and Soto are elite players who became the faces of baseball‚Äôs money era through different tactics. One built a brand empire while the other maximized guaranteed salary. Both approaches worked and changed how the sport sees contracts and long term planning. Their rivalry will play out not only on the diamond but also in the financial story fans follow next.Also read: Inside the fairytale life George Springer shares with his wife Charlise Castro who built her own path before the spotlight
Article Summary: Ohtani and soto are elite players who became the faces of baseball‚Äôs money era through different tactics. One built a brand empire while the other maximized guaranteed salary. Their rivalry will play out not only on the diamond but also in the financial story fans follow next.

Article Title: How teens are slipping past the Australia social media ban using dog photos and fake ages on streaming platforms?
Article Text:
How teens are slipping past the Australia social media ban using dog photos and fake ages on streaming platforms (Image via Getty)

Charlie‚Äôs Snapchat check raises concerns for Twitch and other streaming platforms





Australia has started enforcing a world-first rule that stops kids under 16 from using major social media and streaming platforms. This includes apps like Snapchat, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Twitch and other streaming sites. The goal is simple: keep kids safer online. But even before the ban fully takes effect, teens are already finding ways around the system.Some kids are using fake birth dates. Others are testing selfie checks. And in one strange case shared online, users said they uploaded photos of dogs, including a golden retriever, to age-check systems, and the system still approved them as adults. These stories are raising big questions about how strong and reliable these age checks really are, especially for live streaming platforms where kids spend hours watching and chatting.The issue became very real after Guardian Australia reported on a 15-year-old Sydney boy, called Charlie to protect his identity. Last week, Charlie got a message from Snapchat saying he needed to prove his age to keep using the app because of the new ban. Even though his account used an old birth date that made him look over 16, Snapchat still asked for a check.Charlie chose the selfie option. He took a photo of his face, sent it in, and passed.Seconds later, he got a message saying, ‚ÄúThank you, we won‚Äôt bother you any more.‚Äù Charlie said he was shocked it worked so easily.Charlie‚Äôs mother, Christine, told Guardian Australia she now wants to report her own child‚Äôs account. She questioned how a computer system can really tell the difference between a 15-year-old and a 16-year-old. ‚ÄúIt just feels like we‚Äôre not going to win,‚Äù she said, adding she still hopes the new law helps families in the long run.Snapchat later said it has warned the government about how hard it is to fully block under-age users using current technology. A company spokesperson explained that better age checks might work at phone, device or app-store level. Snapchat also said parents can report accounts they believe belong to under-age children.Meanwhile, teens are still active on other platforms. Charlie said he uses Instagram, TikTok and streaming apps but has not been asked to verify his age there yet. That worries experts, because platforms like Twitch and other live streaming sites often have fewer checks and fast-moving chats.In an opinion piece for News Corp, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said the ban will not be perfect. But he stressed the message matters. Just like drinking laws, he said, rules still help even if some teens find ways to break them.For now, kids, parents, and tech companies are locked in a game of catch-up, and the ban‚Äôs real test is only just beginning.Also Read: Influencer Jeri Wirtz Of Jeri And Mike TikTok Fame Dies At 74 After Nine Year Cancer Fight
Article Summary: Australia has started enforcing a world-first rule that stops kids under 16 from using major social media and streaming platforms. This includes apps like snapchat, instagram, tiktok, youtube, twitch and other streaming sites. But even before the ban fully takes effect, teens are already finding ways around the system.

Article Title: ‚ÄúThe greatest evil": Candace Owens criticizes Erika Kirk becoming TPUSA CEO right after Charlie‚Äôs assassination
Article Text:
Candace Owens criticizes Turning Point USA's swift appointment of Erika Kirk as CEO after Charlie Kirk's assassination. Owens argues the organization rushed leadership during profound grief, potentially placing Erika in an overwhelming role. She suggests an interim CEO would have been a more appropriate transition, allowing time for healing and reassessment.

Candace Owens Explodes; Claims Tpusa Staffer Hid Charlie Kirk‚Äôs ‚ÄòDeath Text‚Äô

Candace Owens argues TPUSA blurred grief with leadership and mishandled a sensitive transition





Turning Point USA has been in the spotlight ever since the tragic assassination of Charlie Kirk in September 2025, but the controversy isn‚Äôt limited to the late conservative figure‚Äôs death. His widow, Erika Kirk, stepped into his CEO role just days after the tragedy, a decision that political commentator Candace Owens believes was rushed and mishandled.During a recent discussion with Russell Brand, Owens questioned whether the organization made the right leadership choice amid profound grief and chaos. Russell Brand uploaded the exchange on December 9, quoting Owens‚Äô blunt reaction: ‚ÄúI think they made a managerial error.‚Äù What followed was Owens‚Äô sharp critique of Erika‚Äôs abrupt appointment and how it may have set TPUSA up for deeper turmoil.According to Owens, the decision to elevate Erika so quickly placed someone who was still processing trauma into a spotlight she didn‚Äôt freely choose. Owens suggested that Erika might be facing either ‚Äúthe greatest evil that ever happened‚Äù or simply ‚Äúterrified‚Äù to suddenly be leading an established conservative powerhouse.She warned that the organization‚Äôs rush created a situation where Erika was expected to defend TPUSA while still mourning. ‚ÄúShe should never become the CEO and chairman overnight,‚Äù Owens said, adding that rapid promotion meant ‚Äúnow when people have questions, you got to answer them, right?‚ÄùOwens argued that the organization should have installed an interim CEO. She insisted that ‚Äúany company would do‚Äù this, allowing time to grieve and reassess rather than trying to mimic Charlie‚Äôs leadership style immediately. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not just a grieving widow, but you very quickly decided that you were equipped to be Charlie,‚Äù she continued, calling Erika‚Äôs new role a ‚Äútrial by fire.‚ÄùThe tension between Owens and TPUSA has only amplified due to a recent livestream dispute, in which Owens accused the organization of misleading her about timing and location. She further questioned why Erika was reportedly directing decisions behind the scenes, posting, ‚ÄúDid she approve of the letter Blake read?‚ÄùStill, Owens maintained she is open to a transparent discussion, saying, ‚ÄúWe can still make this work‚Ä¶ and I would especially like to make this work if you are saying or implying that Erica Kirk is going to be there.‚ÄùThe debate now raises deeper questions: Was TPUSA honoring Charlie‚Äôs legacy, or rushing to contain its future? Candace Owens clearly believes the answer matters, now more than ever.Also Read: Candace Owens alleges Charlie Kirk predicted his own murder in message sent a day before his death
Article Summary: Candace owens criticizes turning point usa's swift appointment of erika kirk as ceo after charlie kirk's assassination. Owens argues the organization rushed leadership during profound grief. She suggests an interim ceo would have been a more appropriate transition, allowing time for healing and reassessment.

Article Title: William Karlsson and Emily Ferguson combined net worth: How the NHL star and TV personality built their fortune
Article Text:
William Karlsson and Emily Ferguson (Image Source: Getty)

William Karlsson‚Äôs NHL salary foundation and career growth

Emily Ferguson‚Äôs transition from television to media entrepreneurship

A growing shared fortune

One of the biggest pro sports and media power couples is William Karlsson and Emily Ferguson. Karlsson amassed his fortune over a long and fruitful NHL career, and Ferguson gathered all the fame from reality television into a durable and profitable digital empire. As a whole, the total wealth comes from player contracts, sponsorship contracts, and long-term brand partnerships. Working together exemplifies the way athletic stardom and media entrepreneurship help to mutually reinforce and broaden financial horizons.Their financial success continues to grow, fueled by Karlsson‚Äôs secure NHL earnings and Ferguson‚Äôs established influencer profile. With both maintaining strong visibility, the couple‚Äôs net worth reflects a dynamic and diversified income portfolio.The main source of Karlsson's fortune comes from his long-running NHL career that became stronger after the season in which Karlsson was alone at the top with the Vegas Golden Knights. He was rewarded with a league-wide recognition for his 43-goal campaign and shortly afterwards, he signed an eight-year, US$47.2 million contract, with a yearly average of almost US$5.9 million. This deal gives him financial security through the end of the 2026‚Äì27 season, which, together with his current income, represents the basis of his long-term earnings.Karlsson not only gets his base salary but also postseason compensation, performance bonuses, and probably endorsement deals arising from being a championship-quality player. Winning the 2023 Stanley Cup with the Golden Knights only enhanced Taylor's marketability, indirectly benefiting his long-term financial value. Given that you know he is going to be consistent on the ice, he is likely going to be earning big paychecks for the rest of his contract.Ferguson cultivated her own successful career after appearing on major reality television franchises, using that initial visibility to establish a strong social media following. Her platform now supports brand partnerships, lifestyle collaborations, sponsored content, and ongoing influencer marketing opportunities. While precise income figures are not publicly released, influencer revenue at her scale commonly produces substantial annual earnings.Balancing motherhood with a steady online presence, she continues to maintain audience engagement, which fuels recurring partnership deals. Her role in the public eye complements Karlsson‚Äôs athletic profile, creating a combined brand appeal that enhances opportunities for both.The streams of income through Karlsson and Ferguson, when combined, present a very stable and growing financial picture. The NHL contract exceeds US $47 million, while influencer revenue earns them a significant supplemental income bucket, bringing the couple's net worth comfortably into the multimillions. In the meantime, the couple will remain well-placed for added household benefit with Karlsson's career still taking its course along with Ferguson's media job on the rise, arguably, over the coming years.Also Read: Phillip Danault trade rumors: Elliotte Friedman weighs in on LA Kings center amid slow NHL season
Article Summary: William karlsson and emily ferguson are one of the biggest pro sports and media power couples. Karlsson amassed his fortune over a long and fruitful nhl career, and ferguson gathered all the fame from reality television into a durable and profitable digital empire.

Article Title: After losing more than $70 billion, Mark Zuckerberg seems to have finally admitted that his biggest bet is 'not working'
Article Text:
$70 billion in losses and counting

Layoffs may be coming to Meta

Meta‚Äôs Secret AI Army: Top Talent Hired from OpenAI, Google & More







Where Metaverse budget cuts may go

Wall Street says: We are with you on this

Meta reportedly delays MR glasses

The day Facebook changed its name to Meta





Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg seems to have finally realised that one of the company's biggest bets‚ÄîMetaverse‚Äîis not working (or not working as expected). It is also the technology that the company changed its very name after. In 2021, after 17 years of being called Facebook, the social networking parent company behind Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and Oculus changed its name to Meta. Now according to a report from Bloomberg, Meta is likely to slash its Reality Labs budget, shaving off as much as 30%. The proposed metaverse cuts are reportedly part of the company's annual budget planning for 2026, which included a series of meetings at Zuckerberg's compound in Hawaii last month.For those unaware, Metaverse unit works on virtual reality headsets and a VR-based social network, which produces the company's Quest mixed-reality headsets, smart glasses made with EssilorLuxottica's Ray-Ban and upcoming augmented-reality glasses. Meta has struggled to sell its vision of an immersive metaverse of interconnected virtual worlds and expand the market for its devices beyond the niche of the gaming community.Analysts see the move reflecting the overall lack of interest in products like Meta‚Äôs social virtual reality platform Horizon Worlds, as well as its virtual reality hardware‚Äîboth in the industry at large, as well as among consumers.Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg‚Äôs Metaverse vision has posted more than $70 billion in losses over the past four years. Little doubt then that Facebook parent's shares rose 4% as the move eased some investor jitters over a bet that CEO Mark Zuckerberg has backed with billions of dollars. "Smart move, just late," told Huber Research Partners analyst Craig Huber to Bloomberg. He added, "This seems a major shift to align costs with a revenue outlook that surely is not as prosperous as management thought years ago. "So, what may really be troubling Metaverse? No one can really pinpoint. But as a report in Fortune says, for many people, the problem is that the value proposition is unclear; Metaverse simply doesn‚Äôt yet deliver a must-have reason to ditch their smartphones or laptops.Reality Labs is made up of a Metaverse unit and a wearables unit. Within the Metaverse unit, executives are reportedly considering making cuts to VR jobs. As the report says, cuts in resources that high are most likely to include layoffs as early as January.The report comes as Meta scrambles to stay relevant in Silicon Valley's artificial-intelligence race after its Llama 4 model met with a poor reception. To fuel its ambitious goals, Meta has committed as much as $72 billion in capital spending this year. The company reorganized its AI efforts under Superintelligence Labs earlier this year, with Zuckerberg said to be personally leading an aggressive talent acquisition, floating offers for startups and directly courting prospects on WhatsApp with million-dollar pay packages. In fact, Meta's big hiring is said to have triggered a talent war in the Silicon Valley.Last month, Meta Platforms said that it will invest $600 billion in the US infrastructure and jobs over the next three years, including artificial intelligence data centers. Meta has doubled down on AI, with a target of achieving superintelligence. Zuckerberg said Meta is building compute because "it's the right strategy to aggressively front-load capacity so we're prepared for the most optimistic cases," on the company's recent earnings call. Meta has forecast "notably larger" capital expenses next year thanks to investments in artificial intelligence, including aggressively building data centers to power its AI push.Incidentally, earlier this week, Zuckerberg announced that Alan Dye, a longtime designer at Apple, is joining Meta to lead a new creative studio inside the Reality Labs division that would focus on design, fashion and technology. Dye will report to Andrew Bosworth, Meta‚Äôs chief technology officer, who leads Reality Labs. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre entering a new era where A.I. glasses and other devices will change how we connect with technology and each other,‚Äù Mr. Zuckerberg said in a post to Threads. ‚ÄúWith this new studio, we‚Äôre focused on making every interaction thoughtful, intuitive, and built to serve people.‚ÄùWall Street sent a clear signal to Meta Platforms that it wants the company to reduce spending on Reality Labs. Wall Street is sending a clear signal to Meta Platforms that it wants the company to reduce spending on Reality Labs. Meta Platforms shares jumped 3.4% on reports that the company was cutting Metaverse spending in favor of AI and smart glasses.Meta has reportedly delayed the launch of its Mixed Reality Glasses (MR Glasses) from the second half of 2026 to the first half of 2027. According to a report in Business Insider, Meta executives announced the delay after meetings with CEO Mark Zuckerberg is said to have told the team to take more time to make the business sustainable and deliver higher quality experiences. The company‚Äôs Metaverse leaders Gabriel Aul and Ryan Cairns reportedly told team that the delay is ‚Äúgoing to give us a lot more breathing room to get the details right. ‚ÄùFacebook already sells VR headsets and Ray-Ban smart glasses. The form factor of Meta's upcoming Glasses will reportedly be similar to that of Apple Vision Pro, with may be more power.In October 2021, after 17 years of being called Facebook, the social networking giant behind Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and Oculus got a new name. Facebook‚Äôs corporate entity became Meta. Mark Zuckerberg announced the change at the company‚Äôs AR/VR-focused Connect event, sharing that the new title captured more of the company‚Äôs core ambition: to build the metaverse.
Article Summary: Reality labs, meta's virtual reality unit, is likely to be cut by as much as 30%. The cuts are reportedly part of the company's annual budget planning for 2026. Analysts see the move reflecting the overall lack of interest in products like meta‚Äôs social virtual reality platform.

Article Title: Phoebe Gates gets $30 million for Phia, that made father Bill Gates say: When your daughter asks if you‚Äôd be willing to work a shift in ‚Ä¶
Article Text:
‚ÄúI‚Äôve entered the startup world again‚Ä¶When your daughter asks if you‚Äôd be willing to work a shift in customer service at her startup, the only right answer is yes.

I‚Äôve spent a lot of time thinking about how technology can make systems more efficient, equitable, and accessible.

But I‚Äôve learned over the years that the best way to understand how something works, or where it breaks, is to go straight to the people using it.

That‚Äôs why I‚Äôll be joining the Phia customer experience team for a day this week. Phia is a fashion-tech tool built to make shopping smarter and more sustainable, and it‚Äôs the brainchild of my daughter Phoebe Gates and her co-founder

Sophia Kianni

.

They‚Äôve built an app and browser extension that helps people shop smarter by finding the best prices, surfacing secondhand options, and showing lower-impact alternatives across thousands of online retailers.

It‚Äôs been inspiring to watch them tackle a massive challenge, rethinking the way we shop, by meeting users where they are.

And now, I‚Äôll be doing the same.

Looking forward to getting back into the startup scene. Hopefully, I won‚Äôt break anything (no promises).

üì≤Download the Phia iOS app for free at join.phia.com

üíªOr if you shop on your computer like me, they have a free chrome extension at gophia.com

Let me know what you think! You never know who‚Äôs on the other end of the customer service line‚Ä¶‚Äù

How the latest funding round will help Phoebe Gates Phia app





Microsoft founder Bill Gates ' daughter Phoebe Gates has raised $30 million funding for her artificial intelligence (AI) shopping startup, Phia. The new funding values the company at $180 million. However, Phoebe Gates‚Äô father has yet to invested in the venture. Instead, the Bill Gates donated his time and experience to her daughter‚Äôs startup. Earlier this year, the tech billionaire took to professional networking site LinkedIn to announce that he was doing a customer service shift to support the team in the days following the launch of the app. He said when a daughter asks for help at her startup, the only right answer is yes.In his LinkedIn post, Bill Gates shared a short clip offering a glimpse of his shift working in the customer service department of his daughter‚Äôs app. He wrote:The latest round of funding is a massive leap in value for Phoebe Gates' startup, coming just months after the New York-based company finished its first fundraising round. It will make the startup one of the most-watched companies in the booming AI market.The company has attracted a long list of famous backers. According to a pitch deck viewed by Bloomberg, investors include Hailey Bieber, Kris Jenner, Sheryl Sandberg, and Spanx founder Sara Blakely.Phia has been designed to serve as an intelligent shopping assistant. Its being offered as an AI agent that will fix the messy online shopping experience. According to the company, customers usually struggle to find what they want and companies end up advertising to people who aren‚Äôt interested and Phia will be able to resolve it.As a computer and mobile phone browser extension, Phia searches for products, price comparisons, and real-time discounts to help users in their buying decisions. Second-hand options are also highlighted by Phia to further assist people in shopping more 'green'.The new financial round is being led by major investment firms, including Notable Capital, Kleiner Perkins, and Khosla Ventures; investors with a history of supporting giants in the tech sector, such as Airbnb.Phia says it was downloaded 750,000 times in just eight months. The idea by Phoebe Gates and her co-founder Sophia Kianni was born while living in a Stanford dorm room; the initial plans were to make a smart tampon but later changed to fashion technology.A $250,000 grant from a Stanford social entrepreneurship program enabled them to work on the project full time and eventually move to New York. Kianni also took a break from her studies so that she could quickly learn everything about the industry they were going to work in, she told Vogue.
Article Summary: Microsoft founder bill gates'daughter phoebe gates has raised $30 million funding for her artificial intelligence (ai) shopping startup, phia. Earlier this year, the tech billionaire took to professional networking site linkedin to announce that he was doing a customer service shift to support the team in the days following the launch of the app.

Article Title: NYT Connections today‚Äôs hints and answers (#912) for 09 December 2025
Article Text:
What is NYT Connections

Yellow group: keep in mind

Green group: striped animals or beasts

Blue group: rainbow linked

Purple group: number‚Äësound start

NYT Connections related FAQs



How do I play the game?

Are hints available?

Can I play NYT Connections for free?

What skills does the game improve?





The New York Times‚Äô Connections has quickly become a favourite among word puzzle enthusiasts, blending the addictive simplicity of Wordle with more complex challenges in logic and pattern recognition. Each day, players face 16 seemingly random words arranged in a 4x4 grid, tasked with sorting them into four distinct thematic groups. Success depends on identifying subtle connections, associations, and clever wordplay, making the game both fun and mentally stimulating. For puzzle lovers looking to test their skills, the December 09, 2025 edition (game #912) offers an ideal mix of challenge and insight, encouraging lateral thinking, careful observation, and strategic reasoning. Connections continues to captivate a global audience as a daily exercise in cognitive skill and mental agility.NYT Connections is a captivating word association game designed to test analytical thinking, lateral reasoning, and cognitive flexibility. Unlike standard word games, players must detect subtle links between words, which can range from obvious to highly nuanced or abstract. The game is freely available on mobile devices and desktop platforms, allowing enthusiasts to play anytime, anywhere, at their convenience.Its combination of easy-to-understand mechanics, challenging puzzles, and complex problem-solving has turned it into a daily ritual for many. The game‚Äôs structure encourages players to sharpen their pattern recognition, develop strategic thinking, improve memory retention, and enjoy a mental workout while having fun.To assist players without giving away the answers directly, here are strategic hints for December 09, 2025:These hints guide players toward recognising patterns, encouraging logical deduction and strategic grouping without removing the challenge entirely.Check below the today's NYT Connections categories to solve the puzzle:For those ready to review their solutions or learn from the puzzle logic, the complete answers for game #912 are:Connections continues to captivate players worldwide, turning each puzzle into a thrilling hunt for hidden patterns, where every correct grouping sparks a moment of ‚Äúaha!‚Äù and keeps the mind sharp for the next challenge.Words are presented in a 4x4 grid. Identify patterns or associations to sort them into four correct categories.Yes, the game provides subtle hints to guide players without revealing the answers outright.Yes, it is available for free on both mobile devices and desktop platforms.It sharpens pattern recognition, logical thinking, lateral reasoning, and problem-solving skills.
Article Summary: Nyt connections is a captivating word association game designed to test analytical thinking, lateral reasoning, and cognitive flexibility. Players face 16 seemingly random words arranged in a 4x4 grid, tasked with sorting them into four distinct thematic groups. Success depends on identifying subtle connections, associations, and clever wordplay.

Article Title: Reddit outage: Thousands of users unable to access app and website
Article Text:
Reddit outage: Users posted reactions of social media





Reddit, the popular social media platform is experiencing a major outage on December 9. Due to the service outage thousands of Reddit users around the world were reported issues with the app and the website. According to outage tracking website DownDetector, around 24,000 users have complained about the outage. The DownDetector data highlights that around 73% users were unable to access the Reddit website, whereas 22% reported issues with server connected and 5% were not able to access the app.The latest Reddit outage seems to have affected multiple regions. Users from all around the world took to social media to report the issue. Many users also speculated that the latest service outage is linked to the ongoing infrastructure upgrades, though Reddit has not yet issued an official explanation.This is not the first time that Reddit has faced a service outage this year. Recently, the social media platform faced a service outage which prevented many users from accessing the platform on both mobile and PC.The platform, which hosts millions of communities and billions of monthly visits, has struggled with intermittent outages as it scales infrastructure to meet growing demand.Reddit users have also shared their reactions of the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) about the service outage. ‚ÄúReddit seems to be having issues right now. The site is completely down for me and pages aren‚Äôt loading at all. Anyone else experiencing the same outage? #reddit,‚Äù wrote a user.‚ÄúSaw this on Reddit. I'm absolutely gobsmacked by the two Leftist idiots trying to stop the cops from saving their lives. Shout-out to the absolute Chad who not only took the suspect down, but then tried to wrangle the two short bus students away from the officers,‚Äù said another user.
Article Summary: Reddit, the popular social media platform is experiencing a major outage on december 9. Thousands of reddit users around the world were reported issues with the app and the website. According to outage tracking website downdetector, around 24,000 users have complained about the outage.

Article Title: Apple's iOS 26.2 update coming soon as the company releases second release candidate
Article Text:
Measure app

Menu animations



Games app

CarPlay

Enhanced Safety Alerts





Apple has seeded the second release candidate (RC) of iOS 26.2 to developers and public beta testers, hinting at the soon launch of the software update. For those unaware, RC represents the final version of an update before it is rolled out to the general public. The new build is numbered 23C54 and replaces the previous RC 23C52. As reported by MacRumours, iOS 26.2 will come with a Liquid Glass slider on the Lock Screen to adjust transparency of the clock.The software update will also bring AirPods Live Translation to the European Union. In addition, the Reminder app is expected to support alarms for when tasks are due. Other features coming to iPhones with iOS 26.2 will includeThe most notable change arrives in the Measure app, which now features a redesigned level tool with a Liquid Glass aesthetic, replacing the previous white circle indicators with more fluid, translucent bubbles. This continues Apple's gradual rollout of its Liquid Glass design language first showcased at WWDC.Menu animations throughout the system have also received attention, with pop-out menus now displaying quicker, bouncier transitions that more closely match Apple's original WWDC demonstrations.Beyond visual updates, the Games app gains practical improvements including library sorting by size alongside existing name and recent options.Real-time score updates during gameplay and enhanced controller navigation round out the gaming experience enhancements.CarPlay users will find a new option to disable pinned conversations in the Messages app, offering greater customization for in-vehicle communication preferences.Apple has also expanded information about Enhanced Safety Alerts, clarifying how the feature delivers emergency notifications for events like earthquakes and floods using available connectivity. The system determines user regions through device location without storing this information permanently.
Article Summary: Apple has seeded the second release candidate (rc) of ios 26.2. Rc represents the final version of an update before it is rolled out to the general public. The most notable change arrives in the measure app, which now features a redesigned level tool with a liquid glass aesthetic.

Article Title: Sam Altman says industry is wrong on OpenAI's competition, it is not from Google, but ...
Article Text: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has declared Apple its ultimate rival, issuing a 'code red' to refocus resources on ChatGPT's dominance. He believes future AI success lies in devices, not just software, and is aggressively poaching Apple engineers for new AI hardware. This strategic shift prioritizes mass-market appeal over AGI research.
Article Summary: Openai ceo sam altman has declared apple its ultimate rival, issuing a 'code red' to refocus resources on chatgpt's dominance. He believes future ai success lies in devices, not just software, and is aggressively poaching apple engineers for new ai hardware.

Article Title: High on Life 2 release date, gameplay, platforms, protagonist, storyline, and more details
Article Text:
Image via Squanch Games

High on Life 2 release date , platforms and more



High on Life 2: Exclusive Early Campaign Gameplay ‚Äì IGN First

High on Life 2 protagonist and storyline



"taken down an intergalactic cartel, brought humanity back from the brink of extinction, and hunted dangerous bounties to the far corners of the galaxy,"

"fortune, fame and love."

"EVIL pharmaceutical conglomerate hell-bent on putting price tags on HUMAN LIFE,"

High on Life 2 gameplay



"kickflip alien cops in the face and grind your way to freedom,"

High on Life was a surprise hit of 2022, thanks to its fusion of humor into the first-person shooter genre. After its massive success, developer Squanch Games is moving fast, with a full sequel on the way in the form of High on Life 2.The upcoming title is set to offer more of the colorful chaos fans loved, alongside new traversal mechanics and a fresh plot. In the section below, there are all the details on High on Life 2‚Äôs release date, platforms, storyline, and more.High on Life 2 is officially scheduled to release on February 13, 2026. The date was finalized following an announcement on Xbox Wire, shifting slightly from its original winter 2025 release window revealed at the June 2025 Xbox Games Showcase. The game is confirmed to be launching on Xbox Series X/S and PC, and most importantly, it will be available on Xbox Game Pass from day one.However, it is essential to highlight that there is currently no mention of a PlayStation or Nintendo Switch 2 release. Nevertheless, the original High on Life eventually made its way to those consoles, suggesting a multiplatform release could happen further down the line.High on Life 2's story picks up where the last adventure left off, and it focuses on the same unnamed bounty hunter protagonist. According to Squanch Games, the hero has already accomplished greatness, havingsecuringHowever, that comfortable life is thrown into chaos when a mysterious figure from their past emerges and places a bounty on the protagonist's own sister's head. The new threat is anmeaning the stakes are higher than ever.In terms of gameplay, High on Life 2 is expected to maintain the fast-paced, first-person shooter that defined the original. However, the developers are introducing exciting new features, most notably a skateboard. Squanch Games has teased that you will be able tosuggesting a significant expansion in traversal and combat mobility across the game‚Äôs worlds.Finally, speaking about the voice cast, it is highly likely that series co-creator Justin Roiland will not be returning. His previous character, Kenny, was already written out of the narrative in the High on Knife DLC, marking a decisive shift for the franchise's creative team.
Article Summary: High on life 2 is scheduled to release on february 13, 2026. The game is confirmed to be launching on xbox series x/s and pc. It will be available on xbox game pass from day one. There is currently no mention of a playstation or nintendo switch 2 release.

Article Title: Paul Skenes' girlfriend Livvy Dunne is shaping a confident fashion presence as her natural look keeps growing with her rising spotlight
Article Text:
Livvy Dunne (Image via: TheStewartofNY/Getty)

Livvy Dunne's early styling choices and her Maxim cover show the clear path of her confident fashion rise



Her fashion journey shows how steady growth can create a strong and lasting presence today

Livvy Dunne, Paul Skenes‚Äô girlfriend, is steadily shaping her style into a confident and natural fashion presence that feels true to her. Her journey becomes clear when looking at both her recent Maxim cover and her older posts, which show the early steps of her growth. The cover highlights her polished look today, while her mirror selfie in a blue dress months ago showed the first signs of a calmer, refined fashion identity. Together they reveal how she has built her style piece by piece through simple and thoughtful choices.The blue dress moment stands out because she styled it in a clean and graceful way. Her sleek hair, soft glam and fitted silhouette worked together to give her a quiet elegance that many now see as part of her signature. It was not a dramatic look, yet it showed how she could balance strength with softness in a natural way. This same balance appears in her Maxim feature, where her confidence comes through with ease and clarity.Those early posts helped shape the base of her fashion identity. The blue dress showed her comfort in simple lines, while the Maxim cover confirmed that her style has matured into something more defined. Both moments reflect the same steady growth as she learns what suits her and what helps her feel her best in front of the camera.As Livvy‚Äôs profile grows, her styling choices have become more sure and consistent. She leans toward soft makeup, structured outfits and relaxed poses that highlight her confidence. Her Maxim cover adds to this story by showing how well her natural style adapts to more polished settings without losing its simplicity.Livvy‚Äôs path proves that a confident fashion presence can grow from small, honest moments. The blue dress post and her Maxim cover work together to show how her style has moved forward with patience and purpose. Her evolution feels genuine because she allows her audience to see both the quiet beginnings and the polished results. Livvy‚Äôs fashion rise continues to grow as she stays true to what feels natural to her.Also read: Shohei Ohtani vs Juan Soto: Who really has the highest net worth in 2025?
Article Summary: Livvy dunne's early styling choices and her maxim cover show the clear path of her confident fashion rise. Together they reveal how she has built her style piece by piece through simple and thoughtful choices. Her evolution feels genuine because she allows her audience to see both the quiet beginnings and the polished results.

Article Title: 'Prolonged leave or work from India': Immigration attorney says H-1B visa appointment cancelations will have 'devastating' effect on US economy
Article Text:
Social media vetting: Reduce number of applicants each day

Donald Trump's Stricter H-1B Visa Rule Hits Indian Talent, Background Check Screening Expanded





As the State Department pushed hundreds of H-1B visa appointments in India to 2026 without any warning, the impact will be devastating, immigration attorney Ellen Freeman wrote on her LinkedIn, adding that US economy will suffer too as Indian workers are now stuck in their own country. H-1B candidates started receiving emails from the consulate about their appointments being canceled and rescheduled in the last two days. The US embassy in India Tuesday issued a statement confirming the same and urging the candidates to not show up at the consulate on their earlier designated dates as they won't be admitted.The Donald Trump administration is starting social media vetting of all H-1B applicants and their spouses fron December 15. While this will e applciable to H-1Bs from any country, the impact has been massive in India as Indian consulates process hundreds of requests every day and now the number has to be reduced because of the additional work of social media vetting.The officials are now supposed to check all social media profiles of the candidates before proceeding further."As of December 15, the Department of State will conduct an online presence review for all H-1B applicants and their dependents, in addition to the students and exchange visitors already subject to this review.Due to operational constraints related to processing these visas and to ensure that no applicants issued a visa pose a threat to US national security of public safety, the US Consulate in Hyderabad must reduce the number of applicants each day. The Consulate will not be able to see you on your original appointment date. Please do not show up at the Consulate. We look forward to assisting you on your new appointment date," the email that US Consulate in Hyderabad sent out read."It appears that 12/15 was rescheduled to March, 12/16 and 12/17 were rescheduled to April, and 12/18 has been rescheduled to May 2025," Ellen Freeman said."H1B workers will lose their jobs now that they are stuck in India. We have to plead with employers to let them either work from India or take prolonged leave of absence for as many as 5 months. In this economic environment and with the deliverables pressure, many employers will not be able to wait. People left their apartment leases, utility bills, car payments in the U.S. The prolonged delay in these visa cancelations will have a devastating effect on our communities and economy. There are human stories behind each visa cancelation and its harsh impact on our colleagues, clients, friends, relatives," Freeman added."Visa stamping feels like a maze of pitfalls right now. Now, appointments are getting canceled without warning and pushed out by months. There is no predictability in this process, and it is creating real challenges for businesses and employees who need to travel," another immigration attorney Emily Neumann said.
Article Summary: The state department pushed hundreds of h-1b visa appointments in india to 2026 without any warning. The impact will be devastating, immigration attorney ellen freeman wrote on her linkedin. "h1b workers will lose their jobs now that they are stuck in india," she said.

Article Title: Netflix faces consumer class action over $72bn Warner Bros deal
Article Text:
Massive Netflix‚ÄìWarner Bros Merger Triggers Industry Panic And Global Streaming Shake-Up

(This is a Reuters story)





Netflix has been hit with a consumer lawsuit seeking to block the online video giant's planned $72 billion acquisition of Warner Bros Discovery's studio and streaming businesses.The proposed class action was filed on Monday by a subscriber to Warner Bros-owned HBO Max who said the proposed deal threatened to reduce competition in the US subscription video-on-demand market. Some members of Congress have sharply questioned Netflix's proposal, which is expected to face significant US regulatory scrutiny under antitrust laws.Netflix did not immediately respond to a request for comment. "Netflix has demonstrated repeated willingness to raise subscription prices even while facing competition from full-scale rivals such as WBD," the lawsuit said. The lawsuit said the Warner Bros deal would eliminate one of Netflix's closest rivals, HBO Max, and give Netflix control over Warner Bros marquee franchises including Harry Potter, DC Comics and Game of Thrones.
Article Summary: Netflix has been hit with a consumer lawsuit seeking to block the online video giant's planned $72 billion acquisition of warner bros discovery's studio and streaming businesses. Some members of congress have sharply questioned netflix's proposal, which is expected to face significant us regulatory scrutiny under antitrust laws.

Article Title: AI videos are fooling millions on social media. No one is ready
Article Text: Videos created with OpenAI's new app Sora show how easily public perceptions can be manipulated by tools that can produce an alternate reality with a series of simple prompts. In the two months since Sora arrived, deceptive videos have surged on X, YouTube, Facebook and Instagram, according to experts who track them. The deluge has raised alarm over a new generation of disinformation and fakes.Most of the major social media companies have policies that require disclosure of AI use and broadly prohibit content intended to deceive. But those guardrails have proved woefully inadequate for the kind of technological leaps OpenAI's tools represent.While many videos are silly memes or fake images of babies and pets, others are meant to stoke the kind of vitriol that often characterises political debate. They have already figured in foreign influence operations. Researchers who have tracked deceptive uses said the onus was now on companies to do more to ensure people know what is real and what isn't."Could they do better in content moderation for mis- and disinformation? Yes, they're clearly not doing that," said Sam Gregory, executive director of Witness, a human rights organisation focused on the threats of technology."Could they do better in proactively looking for AI-generated information and labelling it? The answer is yes, as well."The companies behind the AI tools say they are trying to make clear to users what content is generated by computers. Sora and the rival tool offered by Google, called Veo, both embed a visible watermark onto the videos they produce. Sora, for example, puts a "Sora" label on each video. Both companies also include invisible metadata, which can be read by a computer, that establishes the origin of each fake. The idea is to inform people that what they are seeing is not real and to give the platforms that feature them the digital signals to automatically detect them.Some platforms are using that technology. YouTube uses Sora's invisible watermark to append a small label indicating that the AI videos were "altered or synthetic." "Viewers increasingly want more transparency about whether the content they're seeing is altered or synthetic," said Jack Malon, a YouTube spokesman.People with malicious intent have discovered that it is easy to get around the disclosure rules. Some manipulate the videos to remove the watermarks. Several firms have sprung up offering to remove logos and watermarks.OpenAI said it prohibits deceptive or misleading uses of Sora and takes action against violators of its policies. The company said its app was just one among dozens of similar tools capable of making increasingly lifelike videos - many of which do not employ any safeguards on use. A spokesman for Meta, which owns Facebook and Instagram, said it was not always possible to label every video generated by AI.
Article Summary: Deceptive videos have surged on x, youtube, facebook and instagram. Many videos are silly memes or fake images of babies and pets. Others are meant to stoke the kind of vitriol that often characterises political debate. They have already figured in foreign influence operations.

Article Title: Why undoing the EU combustion engine ban spooks car rentals
Article Text:
Representative photo (AP)

Pleading for concessions



Commercial fleet operators deeply concerned



Slow EV adoption weighs on profits







Europe's auto industry is braced for a major announcement from the EU on December 10, which could see significant changes made to the European Commission's proposed 2035 combustion engine phase-out.However, amid pressure from carmakers and other affected sectors such as car rental and car leasing companies, the announcement may now be pushed back until January."We are still working on it," EU Commissioner for Sustainable Transport and Tourism Apostolos Tzitzikostas told the German business newspaper Handelsblatt this week. "We want to present an automotive package that is truly comprehensive and covers all the necessary aspects."Multiple media reports in recent weeks have suggested the EU Commission plans to force the electrification of rental, leasing and company-car markets by 2030, while significantly relaxing the wider 2035 ban on all internal combustion engines and allowing alternatives to electric vehicles (EVs).An executive with a major car rental company told DW that, based on their discussions with the EU, they expect the EU to propose strict electric vehicle quotas for what are known as fleet operators.They said the discussions suggested that car rental, car leasing and company-car operators could face a quota of up to 90% or higher by 2030."The Commission is not looking for dialogue or discussion, that's our impression," the executive said.The EU Commission said it had no comment to add regarding the negotiations. A spokesperson told DW that preparations for the upcoming package were "ongoing."Back in 2022, the EU's 27 member states reached a deal to effectively ban sales of new combustion engine cars by agreeing to stop new registrations of vehicles that emit CO2 by 2035. The aim was to bring down the car sector's high emissions, as part of the bloc's strategy to become climate-neutral by 2050.However, Europe's car sector has been beleaguered by a range of problems in recent years, struggling with the technological challenge of the shift to electrification and with drastically ramped-up competition from China.German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has been among those urging to EU to soften the 2035 cut-off date. He has asked Brussels for exemptions for various technologies including plug-in hybrids, battery hybrids and some range-extended electric systems which use a petrol-powered generator to charge the battery."It is much more opportune and pragmatic to invest more effort and money in the development of efficient, hybrid systems that will combine the best of the world of internal combustion engines on the one hand and electric mobility on the other," Merz said.Europe's major carmakers support the German government's move."The EU Commission is ignoring market realities and risking employment and competitiveness in one of its key industries," premium carmaker BMW said in a statement provided to DW. "It is crucial that the CO2 regulations are redesigned promptly."The company expects the EU Commission to seriously consider the German proposal before making its announcement. "We are convinced that all drive systems can and must contribute," the statement said. "Effective climate protection requires ambitious yet realistic guidelines, not targets that are detached from the market."German brands such as BMW are particularly dominant when it comes to plug-in hybrids. Along with Mercedes, Volkswagen and Audi, they accounted for more than 41% of all plug-in hybrid sales in the EU in the first ten months of the year. A relaxing of the 2035 ban in favor of plug-in hybrids would significantly benefit them.Yet, carmakers remain worried that any softening of the 2035 ban will be offset by the possible quotas on commercial fleets, which comprise around 60% of all new car registrations in Europe. Car rental firms are especially worried.Sixt, one of the largest European car rental companies, has been vocal about its opposition to the reported EU plans.It says a chronic lack of charging infrastructure for electric vehicles across Europe undermines any push towards electrification."The regulation under discussion would affect more than 60% of all new registrations in Europe and would effectively bring forward the combustion engine ban by around eight years," a company spokesperson told DW.Sixt argues "premature quotas" would deepen Europe's existing dependency on China for batteries and mineral production vital to the automotive sector."A transformation that increases dependency and reduces employment is heading in the wrong direction," the spokesperson said. "Any regulatory framework must be aligned with real-world conditions ‚Äî charging infrastructure, grid capacity, vehicle availability and customer demand."Andrew Mountstephens, general counsel for Sixt, told DW that the company remains committed to emissions-free mobility. However, customer preference still tended strongly towards diesel and petrol cars."We just had to realize that many customers were not yet prepared to go the same pace as we wanted to go," he said, adding that the lack of charging infrastructure across Europe was a central reason for this.Several car rental and car sharing companies have invested in electric models, only to see heavy losses due to lack of customer interest.Hertz reported a massive $2.9 billion (‚Ç¨2.49 billion) loss in 2024 largely due to a failed investment in tens of thousands of Tesla cars, which were expensive to maintain and which customers largely shunned.The problems with charging infrastructure and customer demand are widespread and have capped previously high expectations over how quickly Europeans would take to electric driving.While new registrations of electic vehicles in the EU rose dramatically from 2017 to 2023,there was a decline in 2024 and only 17% of cars registered in 2025 are expected to be fully electric.Patrick Schaufuss, the head of the Center for Future Mobility at consulting firm McKinsey, says he would expect the EU Commission to "take those realities into account" in whatever update it'll come up with."The speed of the transition is maybe not as fast as we have wished for or had planned," he told DW, adding it's vital that any policy platform considers both decarbonization and economic success as "part of a holistic approach."Underscoring that long-term electrification will be the future, Schaufuss however noted that markets were "decoupling" and different regions move at different speeds. "So this transition period is crucial, and maintaining economic success throughout this period is absolutely crucial."
Article Summary: Eu expected to announce major changes to 2035 combustion engine ban on december 10. Announcement may now be pushed back until january. Car rental and car leasing companies are worried about possible electric vehicle quotas. German chancellor friedrich merz has been among those urging eu to soften the 2035 cut-off date.
